ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data

Class StoryList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data.LModel
      • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data.StoryList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StoryList
extends LModel
implements java.io.Serializable
    Models the list of stories. This object is a collection of Story objects that we wish to edit/view. Can be though of as a library. Methods in this class can be used to obtain the different stories in a collection. We can obtain stories from this collection using the various getter methods , and also set and add different stories with the setter methods. object of this class is instantiated all fields are initialized to non-null values.
    See Also:
    Story, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • StoryList

        public StoryList()
        Constructor for the StoryList class. This constructor creates a new empty list of stories. Should only be used if we want to add stories to it later or creating a new collection.
        See Also:
        Story

    • Method Detail

      • getAllStories

        public java.util.List<Story> getAllStories()
        Gets all stories inside from the storyList. This is used when ALL stories needs to be obtained For Example it can be called to obtain all the stories to be shown in a list for some views.
        Returns:
        stories the list of stories
        See Also:
        Story

      • setAllStories

        public void setAllStories(java.util.List<Story> stories)
        Sets all stories in story list. This method should be used to fill our storyList if it was empty before, or if we updated it and adding one at a time would be too troublesome.
        Parameters:
        stories - the list of stories to be set
        See Also:
        Story

      • addStory

        public void addStory(Story s)
        adds a story to the story listview/application. By adding a new story we also have to notify our views that a story has been added so that they can update their representation of the story list. For example a listview maybe updated to reflect that a story has been added to our storylist in the MainActivity
        Parameters:
        s - story that has been added
        See Also:
        Story

      • getStoryAtPos

        public Story getStoryAtPos(int pos)
        Returns the story at the specified position in the list of stories.
        Parameters:
        pos - the index of the Story in the list of stories that is to be retrieved
        See Also:
        Story
